alert.note: Alert for Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 24 at 6:29AM ADT until March 24 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... .Expect, dry conditions with RH near or below 40% along the southern plains, specially by mid-morning and afternoon hours. An increase in winds is anticipated with gusts in sea breeze variations from 25 to 30 mph. Therefore, critical fire weather conditions are expected. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM THIS MORNING TO 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON FOR THE SOUTHERN COASTAL PLAINS OF PUERTO RICO... The National Weather Service in San Juan has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM this morning to 5 PM AST this afternoon. * AFFECTED AREA...Fire weather zones 014 and 027, which includes the southern coastal plains of Puerto Rico. * WIND...Sustained winds around 15 to 20 mph and gusts in sea breeze variations around 25 to 30 mph. * HUMIDITY...RH values near or below 40 possible. * THUNDERSTORMS...None. * HIGHEST THREAT...is located across the southern coastal plains of Puerto Rico, where KBDI values are above the thresholds. At this time, the observed KBDI in Camp Santiago is 699 and the KBDI in Guanica is 651. Given the dry fuels and strong, gusty winds, any fires that occur are likely to easily spread. * IMPACTS...any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Southeast Coastal Plains; Southwest Coastal Plains and Mona Island
